attributes.action: Explore criminal proceedings against the Government relating to covid deaths.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst a Public Inquiry has been announced the timescale and it’s powers remain unknown.  Therefore an urgent review of the criminal liability is needed by the Director of Public Prosecutions
attributes.background: I want Parliament to acknowledge that many deaths could have been avoided and ask the Director of Public Prosecutions to explore the option of criminal proceedings. To date over 150,000 deaths have been attributed to Covid and many could have been avoided if the Prime Minister  took prompt action.

rejection.details: Decisions about investigating alleged offences and prosecuting these are a matter for the police and Crown Prosecution Service, not the Government or House of Commons.
